  • Reference

Compare estimated models

compare_model.Rmd

We consider the data generated in the Section “Generate from a model with data features”.

Consider that you estimate the same model with the MLE and the regression GMWM method as performed in the Section “Estimate a model”:

# estimate model
# estimate mle with hector
fit_mle_hector = gmwmx::estimate_hector(x = gnssts_obj, 
                                              model_string = "wn+powerlaw",
                                              n_seasonal = 1)
class(fit_mle_hector)
## [1] "gnsstsmodel"
fit_mle_hector
## GNSS time series model
## 
##  * Model:  
## 
##  * Functional parameters:
##      bias                           :     +4.15300000 +/- 2.159
##      trend                          :     +0.01428145 +/- 0.002
##      A*cos(U)                       :     +9.47962000 +/- 0.425
##      A*sin(U)                       :    +15.36710000 +/- 0.421
##      jump                           :    +17.12210000 +/- 1.503
##      jump                           :     +2.01053000 +/- 1.535
##      jump                           :     +0.07957720 +/- 1.535
## 
##  * Stochastc parameters:
##      wn_sigma2                      :    +13.45081954
##      powerlaw_sigma2                :    +12.17950422
##      powerlaw_d                     :     +0.35695200
## 
##  * Estimation time: 40.67 s

and an estimation of the model performed using the Regression GMWM:

# estimate gmwm
fit_regression_gmwm = gmwmx::estimate_gmwmx(gnssts_obj, 
                                                          model = "wn+powerlaw", 
                                                          theta_0 = c(0.1,0.1,0.1),
                                                          n_seasonal = 1, 
                                                          robust = F, 
                                                          ci = T)
class(fit_regression_gmwm)
fit_regression_gmwm

We can compare estimated models as such:

compare_fits(fit_mle_hector, fit_regression_gmwm)

We could also consider another model for the residuals and compare the adequacy of the model by comparing the adequacy between the empirical and theoretical model-implied Wavelet Variance. This time we estimate both model with the regression GMWM approach.

fit_regression_gmwm_wn = gmwmx::estimate_gmwmx(gnssts_obj, 
                                                          model = "wn", 
                                                          theta_0 = c(0.1),
                                                          n_seasonal = 1, 

                                                          ci = T)
compare_fits(fit_regression_gmwm, fit_regression_gmwm_wn)
